Package swingtree.api.mvvm

Class AbstractVariable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • swingtree.api.mvvm.AbstractVariable<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the value wrapped by a given property...
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Val<T>, Var<T>
    public abstract class AbstractVariable<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Var<T>
    The base implementation for both Var and Val interfaces. This also serves as a reference implementation for the concept of Var/Val properties in general.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface swingtree.api.mvvm.Val

        EMPTY, UNNAMED

    • Method Detail

      • type

        public java.lang.Class<T> type()
        This returns the type of the value wrapped by this Var which can be accessed by calling the Val.orElseThrow() method.
        Specified by:
        type in interface Val<T>
        Returns:
        The type of the value wrapped by the Var.

      • id

        public java.lang.String id()
        This returns the name/id of the Var which is useful for debugging as well as persisting their state by using them as keys for whatever storage data structure one chooses.
        Specified by:
        id in interface Val<T>
        Returns:
        The id which is assigned to this Var.

      • withID

        public Var<T> withID​(java.lang.String id)
        Use this method to create a new property with an id. This id is used to identify the property in the UI or as a key in a map, which is useful when converting your view model to a JSON object, or similar formats.
        Specified by:
        withID in interface Val<T>
        Specified by:
        withID in interface Var<T>
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the property.
        Returns:
        A new Var instance with the given id.

      • withAction

        public Var<T> withAction​(UIAction<ValDelegate<T>> action)
        Use this method to create a new property with an action which is supposed to be triggered when the UI changes the value of this property through the Var::act(T) method, or simply when it is explicitly triggered by the Var::act(T) method.
        Specified by:
        withAction in interface Var<T>
        Parameters:
        action - The action to be triggered when Var::act() or Var::act(T) is called.
        Returns:
        A new Var instance which is identical to this one, except that it has the given action.

      • act

        public Var<T> act()
        Triggers the action associated with this property, if one was set using Var.withAction(UIAction). This method is intended to be used in the UI to indicate that the user has changed the value of the property not your view model.
        Specified by:
        act in interface Var<T>
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • act

        public Var<T> act​(T newValue)
        Updates the state of this property and then, if the state has changed, trigger its action using the Var.act() method.
        This method is intended to be used in the UI. If you want to modify the state of the property from the view model, as part of your business logic, you should use the Var::set(T) method instead.
        Specified by:
        act in interface Var<T>
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value which ought to replace the old one.
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • orElseThrow

        public T orElseThrow()
        If a value is present, returns the value, otherwise throws NoSuchElementException.
        Specified by:
        orElseThrow in interface Val<T>
        Returns:
        the non-null value described by this Val

      • isPresent

        public boolean isPresent()
        If a value is present, returns true, otherwise false.
        Specified by:
        isPresent in interface Val<T>
        Returns:
        true if a value is present, otherwise false

      • orElseNullable

        public T orElseNullable​(T other)
        If a value is present, returns the value, otherwise returns other.
        Specified by:
        orElseNullable in interface Val<T>
        Parameters:
        other - the value to be returned, if no value is present. May be null.
        Returns:
        the value, if present, otherwise other

      • set

        public Var<T> set​(T newValue)
        This method provides the ability to change the state of the wrapper. It might have several side effects depending on the implementation.
        Specified by:
        set in interface Var<T>
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value which ought to replace the old one.
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • onShowThis

        public Val<T> onShowThis​(UIAction<ValDelegate<T>> displayAction)
        Use this to register an observer lambda which will be called whenever the value wrapped by this Val changes through the Var::set(T) method. The lambda will receive a delegate which not only exposes the current value of this property, but also a fixed number of previous values.
        Specified by:
        onShowThis in interface Val<T>
        Parameters:
        displayAction - The lambda which will be called whenever the value wrapped by this Var changes.
        Returns:
        The Val instance itself.

      • show

        public Val<T> show()
        Triggers the observer lambdas registered through the Val.onShow(Consumer) as well as the Val.onShowThis(swingtree.api.UIAction) methods. This method is called automatically by the Var::set(T) method, and it is supposed to be used by the UI to update the UI components. This is in essence how binding works in Swing-Tree.
        Specified by:
        show in interface Val<T>
        Returns:
        The Val instance itself.

      • allowsNull

        public final boolean allowsNull()
        Specified by:
        allowsNull in interface Val<T>
        Returns:
        If this property can contain null.
